articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Fishery Station No. 15 of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Fishery Station No. 15 of KPA
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, gave field guidance to the Fishery Station No. 15 under KPA Unit 549 which is making a big haul.
					 He highly appreciated the officials and employees of the station for having worked hard to make a big haul true to the Supreme Commander's desire to supply fishes to the servicepersons every day.
					
					 He went round the room dedicated to the history of the station. Seeing with keen interest data on the development of the station inaugurated in 1972, he noted that leader Kim Jong Il had shown special care for the soldiers of KPA Unit 549 President Kim Il Sung wanted to inspect in his lifetime. They would have been very glad to know that the station has made a big haul for the soldiers, he said.
					
					 He toured different parts of the station to learn in detail about its fishing and management.
					
					 It is spectacular to see the pickling tanks and freezing storehouses full of fishes, he said, repeatedly expressing great pleasure over the fact that the station caught thousands of tons of fishes in a few days.
					
					 He called on the station to set a high goal for remarkably increasing the yearly output of fish in a short span of time on the basis of this year's achievement.
					
					 He also stressed the need to arrange enough sharp-freezing and refrigerating facilities for supplying fresh fishes to the soldiers in all seasons and raise the proportion of mechanization in unloading, sorting, freezing and storage works while taking care of fishing boats and economizing in the use of fishing materials.
					
					 The station should be turned into a modern fishery base to go well with shore scenery and to be impeccable even in the distant future, he said, adding it is needed to give face-lifting to all production and living buildings and construct breakwater and wharf better.
					
					 His visit to the station is aimed to not only congratulate it on its achievement in fishing but also provide a fresh turning point in the work of the station, he noted.
					
					 Modernization of the station will help it catch more fishes, he said, adding: The station should be turned into an up-to-date fishery base which can be boasted of in the world, thus making our ongoing efforts produce good results for the servicepersons and civilians. 
					
					  He said that the loud whistle fishing boats in the fisheries run by the KPA are sounding in the area of the east sea to herald big hauls serves as a source of giving inspiring strength to the civil fisheries.
					
					 He expressed belief that the officials and employees of the Fishery Station No. 15 under KPA Unit 549 would renovate the station wonderfully as intended by the Party and greet the 7th WPK Congress with the greater success in fishing as befitting the makers of the history of big fish haul.
					
					 Accompanying him were So Hong Chan, Jo Yong Won and Han Kwang Sang.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Malian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Malian President
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of sympathy to Ibrahim Boubacar Keita, president of Mali, in connection with the extreme terrorist act in its capital city that caused many casualties.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the president, government and people of Mali and bereaved families of the victims.
					
					 Reaffirming the DPRK's principled stand against all forms of terrorism, the message extended firm solidarity to the government and people of Mali in their efforts for achieving peace and security, socio-political stability and unity in the country.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Malian FM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Malian FM
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Tuesday sent a message of sympathy to his Malian counterpart Abdoulaye Diop in connection with the terrorist attack in Bamako that caused many casualties.
					 Reaffirming the DPRK's principled stand of opposing all forms of terrorism, the message sincerely hoped that the Malian people would eradicate the aftermath of such terrible tragedy and restore peace and stability at an early date.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Syrian President
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a reply message from Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on November 18.
					 The Syrian president in his message expressed thanks to Kim Jong Un and the friendly government and people of the DPRK for sending kind congratulations on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
					
					 It sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness at all times and the people of the DPRK greater progress and prosperity.
					
					 It expressed gratitude to Kim Jong Un for his lofty stand of supporting and encouraging the just cause of Syria for defusing the crisis through political dialogue and achieving the peace and stability of the country.

articles.title: Palestinian Diplomats Visit Historic Site Associated with Fatherland Liberation War
articles.content:
Palestinian Diplomats Visit Historic Site Associated with Fatherland Liberation War 
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy Wednesday visited the historic site associated with the Fatherland Liberation War on the 27th anniversary of proclamation of the State of Palestine and the day of the world solidarity with the Palestinian people. 
					 The visitors paid tribute to the photo of President Kim Il Sung in the revolutionary museum. 
					
					 Being briefed on the fact that the President made the U.S. imperialist aggressors sink like the setting sun, they went round the post of the Supreme Command, operation room, etc. 
					
					 They also looked round various mementoes telling about leader Kim Jong Il who cultivated matchless courage and guts of the Songun brilliant commander, learning about the Juche-oriented military strategy and commanding art of the President during the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C.C., UAWK Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C.C., UAWK Held
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The 72nd Enlarged Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) took place in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					 It was attended by members and alternate members of the Central Committee of the union and officials of the union in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue of greeting the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) with high political enthusiasm and unprecedented labor achievements.
					
					 A report was made by Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the union, to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers proposed tasks and ways for greeting the 7th Congress of the WPK with signal achievements.

articles.title: National Sci-Tech Presentation in IT Field Held
articles.content:
National Sci-Tech Presentation in IT Field Held
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A national sci-tech presentation in the IT field was held in Pyongyang on Nov 24 and 25 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the  General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were teachers, researchers, post-graduate students and field officials of more than 10 units including Kim Il Sung University and Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					 The presentation was divided into scientific and technological information panel and computer technology panel. It heard more than 130 papers.
					
					 Many papers were highly appreciated at the presentation.

articles.title: Sci- tech Presentation in Measuring Field Held
articles.content:
Sci- tech Presentation in Measuring Field Held
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the measuring field took place at the State Academy of Sciences under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea on Nov. 24 and 25.
					 It was attended by teachers, researchers, field officials and members of the Three-Revolution Groups of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Pyongyang University of Railways, the State Academy of Sciences, the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, etc.
					
					 Its participants heard more than 90 valuable papers conducive to the country's economic development and the improvement of the people's living standard.
					
					 They discussed ways and measures for widely introducing new modern measuring and analyzing means and measuring methods and generalizing them in various fields of the national economy.

articles.title: Medical Software "Myonguiwon"
articles.content:
Medical Software "Myonguiwon"
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Medical software "Myonguiwon" is winning popularity in the DPRK. It was developed by the Nano Technology Institute of Kim Il Sung University.
					 It consists of several parts dealing with general diagnosis on 1,200 diseases, preliminary diagnosis on 350 diseases on the basis of 30-odd symptoms, 3,000 kinds of remedies, medicaments, common medical knowledge, etc.
					
					 According to Prof. and Dr. Kim Thaek Jong, it is convenient to be used at hospitals and families as it guarantees over 70 percent of exactitude and takes only a few seconds in making diagnosis.
					
					 "Myonguiwon" was registered as the best homemade IT product. It can be also installed in tablet computers or smart phones.

articles.title: Yonthan County, Model of Local Industrial Development
articles.content:
Yonthan County, Model of Local Industrial Development
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Big efforts have been paid to the development of local industry in the DPRK.
					 Yonthan County, North Hwanghae Province is taking the lead in developing its industry. As a result, the county was awarded the title of Model County in Local Industry.
					
					 In recent years alone, the county has upgraded all its local industrial establishments, including foodstuff factory, daily necessities factory, paper mill and textile mill.
					
					 Over the past three years its gross industrial output value has increased by 1.3 times.
					
					 What is more praiseworthy is that the production of consumer goods entirely depends on locally available raw materials.
					
					 The Furniture Production Cooperative in the county, in particular, is producing with locally available materials a variety of furniture popular among inhabitants.
					
					 The county is also paying deep attention to the development of agriculture as well as its afforestation.

articles.title: Effective Use of Industrial Waste Established
articles.content:
Effective Use of Industrial Waste Established
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A research group of the Building Materials Institute under Pyongyang University of Architecture has established a method of producing building materials from industrial waste.
					 The group succeeded in making different pigments, synthetic gypsum and indoor and outdoor water-glass paints from industrial waste and completed a technology of coloring granite.
					
					 It also paved the way for producing building materials from industrial waste on an industrial basis in a short span of time.
					
					 Those building materials are getting popular among consumers for their good quality and economic effectiveness.
					
					 The research group is pushing ahead with the work to diversify building materials made from industrial waste.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Show Their Will for Improving Relations in Practice
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Show Their Will for Improving Relations in Practice 
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to bring about a great turn in the inter-Korean relations and open up a broad avenue to independent reunification through dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should positively respond to the DPRK's efforts as the party concerned of the dialogue between the north and the south to improve relations.
					
					 The provocative saber-rattling being staged in south Korea is a serious obstacle lying in the way of dialogue and the process for improving the relations between the north and the south.
					
					 The south Korean authorities pretend to be deeply interested in the north-south dialogue, while paying lip-service to "talks between authorities." 
					
					 However, they are trumpeting about OPLAN 5015 which calls for "bolstering up the capability for striking the headquarters " and working in real earnest to put into practice the "4D operation plan," a scenario for a preemptive attack on the north. This attitude of the south Korean authorities goes to clearly prove their double-dealing approach.
					
					 While talking about the dialogue between authorities of the north and the south, they are persistently crying out for "urgent solution of the north's nuclear issue" and the settlement of "its human rights issue" and seeking cooperation with outside forces in the anti-DPRK nuclear racket and human rights campaign. 
					
					 Their anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign aimed to groundlessly slander the most advantageous socialist system in the world and carry out the scenario for achieving the "unification of social systems" would only lead to catastrophe of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 They should not just talk about the "talks between the authorities" but show the will for having dialogue and improving the relations in practice.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japanese Reactionaries for Harboring Illusion of Realizing Their Old Dream
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japanese Reactionaries for Harboring Illusion of Realizing Their Old Dream
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the Self-Defence Forces finished a large-scale project for deploying 34 "Patriots" in 15 military bases.
					 What is more serious is that Japan is mulling revising the Article 9 of its Constitution disallowing it to go to a war. This is spearheaded by the Japanese chief executive. 
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes: 
					
					 The above-mentioned fact goes to prove that the moves of the ultra-right ruling forces of Japan to turn it into a war state have reached their height.
					
					 The Japanese ruling forces have trumpeted about "proactive pacifism" in recent years. The deployment of "Patriots" and attempts for the retrogressive revision of the Article 9 of the Constitution are being also pushed forward under the motto of "proactive pacifism".
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Viewed from these facts, the true meaning of "proactive pacifism" is militarism and a theory of reinvasion.
					
					 It is not exaggeration to say that the present Japanese government is militarist one.
					
					 If the Article 9 which requires Japan to give up a war and disallows it to have an army and the right of belligerency is retrogressively revised, Japan will emerge a war state.
					
					 It is a matter of time for Japan to appear as such. If one's ambition reaches its height, one is bound to go reckless and if one harbors an excessive wild dream, one is destined to go ruin.
					
					 In the past Japan sustained a bitter defeat due to its wild ambition to grab land and hold hegemony over the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Japan's wild ambition and daydream are getting worse than the past.
					
					 The Japanese ruling forces would be well advised to behave themselves, keenly aware that a bottomless pitfall is awaiting them.

articles.title: Japan Must Redress Its Past for Its Future
articles.content:
Japan Must Redress Its Past for Its Future
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Norman Mineta, former American secretary of Transportation, held a press conference during his recent Japan visit at which he expressed his views that the Japanese government should make an official apology and the Japanese Diet should play a major role in making reparation for the "comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army" as regards the issue on the postwar settlement.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 What Norman Mineta uttered concerning the issue of Japan's redemption of its past reflected not his personal view but the unanimous will of the broad international community.
					
					 In the past the Japanese imperialists not only massacred people by all sorts of brutal methods baffling human imagination wherever they occupied and drove many people into battlefields and slave labor sites, taking so many human lives.
					
					 It was something unprecedented in the world war history that a state directly organized and commanded hideous crimes against humanity by using government and military power.
					
					 That was why Japan should duly admit such crimes and take state measures to redress its past crimes.
					
					 Japan's image is very miserable in the international arena as it has behaved so meanly without an iota of human conscience and morality.
					
					 Many countries in the world are not willing to be on good terms with Japan which is morally unsound and degenerate and it stands increasingly isolated diplomatically.
					
					 Japan's liquidation of its past is a commitment which should be fulfilled not for others but for its future.
					
					 The more desperate efforts of Japan to evade the responsibility for its past crimes would make its position more difficult, warns the commentary.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Searches KCTU Offices
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Searches KCTU Offices
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency hurled more than 370 policemen into operations for searching offices of the headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, progressive labor movement organization, and its affiliated bodies on November 21, according to the south Korean CBS and MBC. 
					 The fascist policemen stormed at least ten offices of the KCTU headquarters and eight trade unions including the Metal Workers Trade Union and Builders Trade Union and conducted the search operation early in the morning under the pretext of seeking "evidence proving the spearheading of the violent demonstration." 
					
					 The KCTU held a press conference outside Sodaemun Police Station in Seoul at which it declared that the police's search is like the guilty party filing the suit first. 
					
					 The assailant's suppression of the victim would spark strong uproar among the people, the KCTU warned.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Helicopter Crashes in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Helicopter Crashes in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A helicopter of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces crashed in Jongsan-ri, Puron-myon, Wonju City, south Korean Kangwon Province while being busy with a drill for invading the north on November 23, according to the south Korean CBS.
					 The crash left the helicopter completely burnt and two American pilots dead.

articles.title: Police under Fire for Refusing to Make Apology for Brutal Suppression
articles.content:
Police under Fire for Refusing to Make Apology for Brutal Suppression
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial on Tuesday denounced the fascist police for refusing to make an apology for bestial crackdown on protesters.
					 The editorial said:
					
					 A peasant has been hovering between life and death for ten days after being hit hard by the police's water cannon firing during the all-out people's action. But the chief of the Police Agency has refused to make an official apology asserting it was not an excessive suppression.
					
					 When a lawmaker from an opposition party accused him of breaching the guideline for using water cannon, he let loose sophism that police may not abide by the guideline when it is hard to observe it, the editorial charged.
					
					 It demanded the police admit their violent suppression of protesters and make an apology to the victim and people.

articles.title: Probe into Truth about U.S. Dangerous Anthrax Experiments
articles.content:
Probe into Truth about U.S. Dangerous Anthrax Experiments
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A member of the Kyonggi Provincial Assembly of south Korea from an opposition party on November 19 demanded the U.S. probe the truth about the dangerous anthrax experiments conducted by its forces, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 He recalled that there were suspicions about a series of anthrax experiments conducted by the U.S. forces in the Osan U.S. air force base in the past to which active anthrax germs were illegally introduced.
					
					 Assailing the U.S. for handling south Korea as the most easy object to deal with, he said it is a humiliating attitude for the "government" not to strongly react against the illegal introduction of anthrax germs.

articles.title: All-People Measure Council for Denouncing Police's Suppression Formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
All-People Measure Council for Denouncing Police's Suppression Formed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The all-people measure council was formed in Seoul on Tuesday to denounce the riot police's brutal suppression of the November 14 all-out people's action, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People. 
					 The measure council groups 107 organizations including the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations, the Federation of Women Peasants Associations, the Catholic Peasants Association of south Korea and labor, human rights and religious bodies. 
					
					 The measure council at a press conference held in connection with its formation accused the police of firing tear liquid and water cannons at the participants in the all-out people's action and walking off dozens of them.
					
					 It is the bitter lesson we learned that if we allow the violent action by the power, it will trample down democracy and people's living, the council held.
					
					 The council declared it would launch legal counteractions aiming at the probe into the truth behind the police's brutal suppression, heavy punishment of the chieftain, the "government's" responsible apology and prevention of its recurrence and signature campaign, candlelight action, etc.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Uganda
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Uganda
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed in Kampala, Uganda on November 19.
					 Henri Masico, department director of the Presidency of Uganda, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising the lofty revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Brazilian Political Figure Supports Conclusion of Peace Treaty between DPRK and U.S.
articles.content:
Brazilian Political Figure Supports Conclusion of Peace Treaty between DPRK and U.S.
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, dedicated a statement to the Brazilian paper Hora do Povo on Nov. 18.
					 The Korean peninsula is still technically at war due to the Armistice Agreement concluded in 1953, the statement noted, and went on:
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty is the best way for putting a final end to the Korean War which saw ceasefire in 1953 in the light of the interests of the international community which hopes for regional peace and does not want a war.
					
					 The armistice agreement was not concluded between the north and the south of Korea. Therefore, the peace treaty must be concluded between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 However, the U.S. is not willing to conclude the peace treaty for the purpose of carrying out its strategy for dominating the Korean Peninsula, a world strategic region.
					
					 It is persisting in provocations, threat and economic sanctions against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK is left with no option but to bolster up its war deterrent for ensuring the defense, sovereignty and territorial integrity of the country as long as the U.S. and its allies' hostile acts persist.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article on its website on November 18 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The article titled "Legacies of leader Kim Jong Il" said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il left his great exploits guaranteeing the eternal foundation and rosy future of socialist Korea as legacies.
					
					 He formulated the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, as the integrated system of idea, theory and method of Juche. 
					
					 He developed the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) into an ever-victorious guiding force, the DPRK into an invincible socialist state and the Korean People's Army (KPA) into a matchless army.
					
					 He turned the whole society into one large family and consolidated the whole country as a politico-ideological power in which all the people are single-mindedly united by pursuing the benevolent politics of love and trust.
					
					 He also laid an eternal foundation for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The undying feats Kim Jong Il performed by dedicating all his life will always remain shinning as the most precious legacies guaranteeing the victory of the socialist cause of the DPRK and the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Swiss Bodies Hit Japan's Fabrication of "Ulsa Five-point Treaty"
articles.content:
Swiss Bodies Hit Japan's Fabrication of "Ulsa Five-point Treaty"
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Nov. 18 in support of the memorandum released by the History Society of the DPRK in connection with the lapse of 110 years since the Japanese imperialists fabricated "Ulsa  Five-point Treaty."
					 The statement said:
					
					 The memorandum said that the "treaty" fabricated by the Japanese imperialists on Nov. 17, 1905 was an illegal and fraudulent document as it left incurable wounds in the hearts of the Korean people by reducing Korea into Japan's colony and forcing them into disgraceful slavery.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists concocted the "treaty" by violence, terrorism, threat and blackmail in a bid to turn Korea into Japan's colony.
					
					 However, Japan is making sheer sophism that its colonial rule over Korea was "legally valid."
					
					 It should admit the illegality of the "treaty" and make apology and reparation for the crimes it committed against the Korean people.
					
					 We support the memorandum and vehemently denounce the above-said crimes of the Japanese imperialists.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Empresa Pesquera No. 15, adscrita a Unidad 549 de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Empresa Pesquera No. 15, adscrita a Unidad 549 de EPC
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Empresa Pesquera No. 15, adscrita a la Unidad 549 del EPC, que logra la rica cosecha de pescado.
					 El Mariscal dijo que los funcionarios y pescadores de la empresa se esfuerzan mucho por capturar muchos peces uniendo su alma con el afecto del Comandante Supremo de suministrar cada dia el pescado a los militares, y evaluo altamente sus meritos laborales.
					
					  El Mariscal paso revista por la sala de presentacion del historial.
					
					  Viendo con atencion los datos que muestran la trayectoria de la empresa fundada en 1972, el Mariscal recordo que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il dispensaba el amor peculiar a los militares de la unidad 549 del EPC, que queria visitar tanto el Presidente Kim Il Sung en su vida. Y anadio que los grandes Lideres estaran muy alegres al conocer el hecho de que capturaron muchos peces para suministrar a los militares de esa unidad.
					
					  Recorrio varios lugares de la empresa haciendo conocimiento detallado del estado de captura de peces y de las actividades de gestion.
					
					  Es muy llamativo los montones del pescado acumulado en los tanques de saladura y en los depositos frigorificos, apunto y expreso reiteradamente una gran satisfaccion diciendo que deviene un gran exito el que han capturado en unos dias los miles toneladas de peces.
					
					  Acoto que la empresa debe tomar la meta alta para incrementar vertiginosamente en un corto tiempo la productividad anual a base de los exitos alcanzados este ano.
					
					  Asevero que a fin de suministrar los pescados frescos en todas las estaciones, hay que equipar con las instalaciones de supercongelacion y refrigeracion y elevar el nivel de mecanizacion en el desembarco, la coleccion, la refrigeracion y el almacenamiento, y, al mismo tiempo, tienen que cuidar los barcos de pesca y ahorrar los instrumentos de pesca.
					
					   Hablando de la necesidad de convertir la empresa en una base moderna de acuerdo con el panorama de la costa, senalo que hay que remodelar todos los edificios de produccion y vida y construir mejor el malecon y el desembarcadero.
					
					   Vengo aqui no solo para felicitar los exitos laborales, sino tambien para preparar el motivo de nuevo viraje en el trabajo de la empresa, senalo.
					
					   La empresa modernizada podra capturar mucho mas los peces, dijo y subrayo en la necesidad de convertirla en una moderna base pesquera de talla mundial para convertir nuestros esfuerzos en los trabajos mas valiosos para los militares y civiles coreanos.
					
					   La sirena de los barcos pesqueros de la rama pesquera del EPC que se suena en toda la region del Mar Este, da gran animo a los dominios pesqueros civiles y se sirve de una fuerza motriz.
					
					   Estimulo a los funcionarios y pescadores de la empresa diciendo que ellos acogieran el VII Congreso del PTC con los mayores exitos de pesca despues de concluir excelentemente la remodelacion y la modernizacion de la empresa de acuerdo con el proposito del partido, como protagonistas de la creacion e la historia del mar oro.
					
					   El Mariscal fue acompanado por So Hong Chan, Jo Yong Won y Han Kwang Sang.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de respuesta de Presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de respuesta de Presidente sirio
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de respuesta que le enviara el dia 18 el Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					  La misiva va como sigue:
					
					   Expreso a Vd. y al amistoso gobierno y pueblo de vuestro pais por el hecho de que Vd. haya enviado una cordial felicitacion con motivo del 45o aniversario del Movimiento de Rectificacion en la Republica Arabe de Siria.
					
					   Deseo a Vd. siempre buena salud y felicidad y a su pueblo mayor progreso y prosperidad.
					
					   Aprovecho esta oportunidad para dar agradecimiento a la noble posicion de Vd. que apoya nuestra causa justa para resolver la crisis y alcanzar la paz y estabilidad del pais a traves del dialogo politico.
					
					   Con mi mas alta consideracionl.

articles.title: Sera irrealizable ambicion expansionista de Japon, apunta Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Sera irrealizable ambicion expansionista de Japon, apunta Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Recientemente, las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon emplazaron en 15 bases militares de su pais 34 complejos de misiles interceptores Patriot de marca norteamericana. 
					Lo mas grave del caso es que Japon trata de modificar a toda costa el articulo 9 de la Constitucion que prohibe hacer la guerra. Al frente de esta farsa se encuentra el gobernante japones. 
					
					El hecho evidencia que han llegado al climax las maniobras de los gobernantes ultraderechistas de Japon tendentes a convertir su pais en el de guerra. 
					
					Revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este miercoles y continua:
					
					En los ultimos anos, los gobernantes japoneses insisten tanto en el "pacifismo activo". Detras de esta cortina, perfeccionaron el emplazamiento de los complejos de misiles interceptores Patriot y pretenden modificar el articulo 9 de la Constitucion. 
					
					La verdadera naturaleza del "pacifismo activo" es el militarismo y la teoria de nueva agresion. 
					
					No es una palabra exagerada decir que el actual gobierno japones es el militarista. 
					
					En el caso de modificar el articulo 9 de la Constitucion que estipula la renuncia de guerra, combate y derecho a la  beligerancia, Japon expondra su fisonomia como Estado de guerra. 
					
					Esto es la cuestion del tiempo. 
					
					La codicia e ilusion extremadas lleva al pais al arruinamiento. 
					
					En el tiempo pasado, Japon sufrio la derrota amarga por su codicia expansionista y la ilusion vana de tomar la hegemonia en la region de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					La codicia y la ilusion de Japon de hoy superan las de ayer. 
					
					Los gobernantes japoneses deben actuar con prudencia para no caer en el abismo sin salida.

articles.title: Liquidacion del pasado se necesita para futuro de Japon, apunta Minju Joson
articles.content:
Liquidacion del pasado se necesita para futuro de Japon, apunta Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En una entrevista de prensa sostenido durante su reciente visita a Japon, el ex secretario de Transporte de Estados Unidos, Norman Mineta, expreso la opinion de que el gobierno japones debe pedir disculpa oficial con respecto al problema del tratamiento de posguerra y la dieta japonesa debe cumplir el rol principal en el problema de indemnizar a las ex "consoladoras" para el ex ejercito japones.
					 Estas palabras del ex secretario estadounidense no son su simple opinion personal, sino el reflejo de la voluntad unanime de la amplia sociedad internacional.
					
					 Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y prosigue:
					
					 En el pasado los imperialistas japoneses perpetraron con inimaginables metodos bestiales el exterminio masivo en todos los lugares ocupados y llevaron por fuerza a numerosas personas a los lugares de guerra y duro trabajo.
					
					  En la historia de guerra mundial no hubo un ejemplo de que el Estado organizo y comando directamente el crimen anti-etico de categoria especial abusando de su autoridad gubernamental y militar.
					
					  Por tanto, Japon debia reconocer debidamente su crimen historico y tomar las medidas estatales para liquidar sus crimenes del pasado.
					
					  Pero, el actua vilmente sin una conciencia ni moral, razon por la cual la imagen de Japon esta manchada en la escena internacional.
					
					  Muchos paises del mundo no quieren llevarse bien con Japon, pais malsano y corrupto en lo moral. Por eso, se profundiza dia y dia el aislamiento diplomatico de este pais isleno.
					
					  La liquidacion del pasado es el problema a ser solucionado sin falta no para otros paises, sino para el futuro del Japon.
					
					  Cuanto mas Japon hace desesperados esfuerzos por evitar la responsabilidad de liquidacion del pasado, tanto mas sera dificil su situacion.
